requirements: Some understanding of US income tax law
courses.description:
This education tax credits & education tax benefits course will discuss tax benefits related to education, focusing on education tax credits including the American Opportunity Tax Credit and the Lifetime Learning tax credit.
The course will describe the benefits of the American Opportunity Tax Credit, giving practical examples using actual tax forms. As we learn the concepts of the American Opportunity tax credit, we will run examples and scenarios using tax software and tax forms to get a feel of how the credit reacts to different tax circumstances.
We will describe the benefits of the Lifetime Learning Tax Credit, giving practical examples using actual tax forms. As we learn the concepts of the Lifetime Learning tax credit, we will run examples and scenarios using tax software and tax forms to get a feel of how the credit reacts to different tax circumstances.
The course will discuss how the American Opportunity tax credit and Lifetime Learning tax credit interact with each other and how to maximize tax benefits.
We will discuss the deduction for student loan interest, describing circumstances where student loan interest is deductible, and giving practical examples using tax forms.
The course will discuss the tax benefits of a Coverdell Education Savings Accounts (ESA). We will consider how a Coverdell Education Savings Accounting (ESA) is set up, the tax benefits, and tax consequences of distributions. The course will also discuss how the Coverdell Education Saving Account (ESA) works or coordinates with education credits like the American Opportunity tax credit and Lifetime Learning tax credit.
We will discuss the tax benefits of a Qualified Tuition Program (QTP). We will discuss how a Qualified Tuition Program (QTP) is set up, the tax benefits, and tax consequences of distributions. The course will also explain how the Qualified Tuition Program (QTP) works or coordinates with education credits like the American Opportunity credit and Lifetime Learning credit.
target_audience: Anybody who wants to save on taxes

requirements: Cukup Memiliki Hak Akses Internet Dengan Device PC/Laptop/SmartPhone
courses.description:
Sistem inti administrasi perpajakan yang baru telah diluncurkan secara resmi oleh Presiden Prabowo Subianto pada 31 Desember 2024. Sistem yang diberi nama Coretax DJP melayani seluruh administrasi perpajakan mulai dari registrasi, penyampaian SPT, pembayaran, dan layanan sejak masa Januari 2025 dan seterusnya.
Untuk mengakses layanan perpajakan pada Coretax DJP, wajib pajak dapat melakukan langkah-langkah sebagai berikut:
1. Bagi WP dengan Akun DJP Online
Wajib pajak yang telah terdaftar pada layanan elektronik DJP (DJPOnline) dapat langsung menggunakan Coretax dengan cara melakukan set ulang kata sandi melalui menu Lupa Kata Sandi.
2. Bagi WP tanpa Akun DJP Online
Bagi wajib pajak yang sudah memiliki NPWP tetapi belum pernah menggunakan layanan DJP Online tetap dapat mengakses Coretax DJP dengan cara mengajukan permintaan aktivasi melalui menu Aktivasi Akun Wajib Pajak.
3. Bagi WP Baru
Bagi mereka yang belum memiliki NPWP dan bermaksud mendaftarkan diri sebagai wajib pajak, maka dapat menggunakan Coretax untuk melakukan pendaftaran NPWP. Registrasi dapat dengan mudah dilakukan yaitu melalui menu Daftar di Sini.
Yang akan kita bahas disini adalah :
1. Journey,
2. Laman Login,
3. Role Access,
4. Digital Certificate,
5. Penggantian PIC,
6. Penambahan Akses Pegawai,
7. Penambahan Kuasa,
8. Pendaftaran Kuasa Ke Database Coretax Oleh Pemberi Kuasa,
9. Pencabutan Kuasa,
10. Akses Taxpayer Profile,
11. Dashboard Faktur,
12.Faktur Keluaran,
13. Faktur Masukan,
14. SPT Masa PPN.

courses.title: 日本スリランカ租税条約の解説
courses.bio: スリランカのYouTuberは日本で課税されるのか？
requirements: 特になし
courses.description:
国際税務に興味のある方々のために無料コースを作りました。
一般に国際税務に興味がある方々には、国際税務の基礎知識が身に付きます。
国際税務、スリランカに興味がある方々は気楽に観てください。
国際税務、スリランカに興味のある一般の方々はもちろんですが、特に、１）国際税務に興味のある企業の経理担当者、２）国際税務を勉強する必要に迫られている税理士、国際税務を業務の柱にしたい弁護士、公認会計士、４）会計・租税法の研究者、５）租税法修士論文の作成を志す大学生、大学院生に観て欲しいと思います。
１）企業の経理担当者であれば、急速に増加する国際取引に対応するためのOECDモデル租税条約の考え方、学び方の基礎知識が身に付きます。
２）税理士の方々であれば、OECDモデル条約を中心に国際税務の基礎的な知識が身に付き、今後の国際税務の実務に対応できるようになります。
３）弁護士、公認会計士の方々であれば、業務の柱として非常に有望な国際税務の基礎的な知識が、OECDモデル租税条約を中心に身に付きます。
４）会計・租税法の研究者の方々であれば、OECDモデル租税条約のみならず特殊な日本スリランカ租税条約の基本的な読み方、考え方を再確認することができます。
５）大学生、大学院生で国際税務をテーマに修士論文作成を志す方々であれば、国際税務の基礎知識であるOECDモデル租税条約の読み方、考え方のみならず、特殊な租税条約である日本スリランカ租税条約の読み方、考え方が理解できるようになります。
「日本が締結した租税条約の概要」を用いて租税条約のリサーチの当たりの付け方、OECDモデル租税条約と他の条約の比較の方法を学びます。
OECDモデル条約と日本スリランカ租税条約を題材に正しい租税条約の読み方をレクチャーします。
スリランカのYouTuberに税金が課税されるかの答えもレクチャーします。
target_audience: 国際税務に興味がある方々一般のための入門コースです。スリランカに興味がある方々を含めて、気軽に受講してください。

requirements: 特になし
courses.description:
このコースでは、電子帳簿保存法とは何か？を基礎から学ぶことができます。


あなたは、電子帳簿保存法のこと、知っていますか？
「名前ぐらいは聞いたことがある」
「名前すら知らない」
「なんとなくは知っているけど、どんな対応をすればいいのかわからない」
そんな方は多いかと思います。


実は、この「電子帳簿保存法」は、すべての事業者が対象なのです。
法人であろうが、個人事業主であろうが、副業で商売をしていようが、関係ありません。
全事業者がこの法律に従わなければなりません。
もちろん、この法律を知らずに違反をしていたら、税務署から罰則があります。


つまり、すべての事業者が知らなければならない法律なのです。


そこで、このコースでは、どんな人でも理解できるように、電子帳簿保存法の基礎をわかりやすくお伝えします。
特に、小規模な事業を行っている方々としては、電子対応するのが非常に困難で、コストもかかることから、どこまで対応すべきか悩ましい所ですが、このコースを受講することで、自社の身の丈に合った最適な対応策を把握することができます。


ぜひ、このコースで「電子帳簿保存法」をしっかり理解し、事前の準備を行ってください。


※追加レクチャーにて、令和5年度の税制改正に関する最新情報も盛り込んでいます。
target_audience: 個人事業主・フリーランス
電子帳簿保存法の基本が知りたい方
電子帳簿保存法に違反するとどんなペナルティがあるのか知りたい方
電子帳簿保存法という言葉をよく聞くけど、中身をよくわかっていない方

courses.title: TheTaxMasterClass - 2018 Tax Planning Strategy
courses.bio: Securing Your Future Through Tax Planning
objectives: Save taxes on very next return
Reduce tax exposure through proper tax planning
Understand impact of 2017 Tax Cut and Jobs Act
Develop strong technical foundation of tax law

How the Tax System Works: How the Tax System Works- Businesses

requirements: Basic knowledge of you current finances (ie W2 Wages, mortgage, loans, etc)
courses.description:
What is Included:
-15 Lectures

-75 Page Textbook
-Access to community discussion
-Current tax law as of 2018
Course Introduction:




TheTaxMasterClass is an online course that helps students navigate the complexities of tax law. Based on the latest law from the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, this course teaches practical tax planning strategies within the new tax environment. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with strategies to maximize their deductions in the short term and minimize tax exposure in the long term.
We've all heard the story before. Mitt Romney, multi-millionaire congressman, paid an effective tax rate of roughly 14% in 2011! How is it possible that the someone making that amount of money pays a lower tax rate than most Americans?
The answer? Proper tax planning.
Proper tax planning is perhaps the most important step to the promised land of financial freedom. The strategy is simple- the more income that you generate at a tax free or a lower tax rate means the more money you get to keep. If you reinvest this money, your money works for you, generating a stream of passive income ultimately accumulating wealth.
Anyone can apply these strategies- not everyone knows about them.
2018 Tax Reform marks the most significant overhaul to the US tax code for over 30 years. There are major changes to the tax code that will have a substantial impact to individuals and companies alike. Given these sweeping changes, there is no better time than now for individuals to sort out their income tax strategy.
target_audience: All Americans / ex-pats filing taxes in the United States

requirements: Aucune expérience ou compétence nécessaire. Cours pour débutant
courses.description:
Dans ce cours, nous te proposons une approche claire, progressive et accessible pour comprendre tous les fondements de la fiscalité personnelle. Que tu sois totalement débutant ou simplement en quête de rappels structurés, ce module t’accompagne pas à pas pour t’aider à mieux gérer ta situation fiscale.
Tu commenceras par explorer les bases indispensables : qu’est-ce que la fiscalité et à quoi sert-elle ? Comment est organisé le système fiscal en France ? Tu apprendras également ce qu’est un foyer fiscal, comment il est constitué et quelles sont les conséquences de sa composition sur le calcul de l’impôt. À travers un exemple concret, tu comprendras comment est déterminé l’impôt sur le revenu (IRPP), en tenant compte du barème progressif, du quotient familial et des éventuelles charges déductibles.
Ensuite, nous te guiderons pour bien distinguer trois notions clés : la déduction fiscale, la réduction d’impôt et le crédit d’impôt. Tu comprendras leurs différences, leurs effets sur le montant final à payer, et dans quelles situations chacun s’applique.
Enfin, ce module t’exposera des leviers concrets pour réduire ton impôt de façon légale et optimisée. Nous aborderons plusieurs dispositifs efficaces, comme certains investissements (immobilier, épargne retraite…), des dépenses ciblées (emploi à domicile, dons aux associations, etc.) ou encore des mécanismes incitatifs mis en place par l’État.
L’objectif est que tu sois capable, à l’issue de cette section, de mieux comprendre ta propre fiscalité et d’adopter des choix éclairés.

courses.title: Fundamentos do Planejamento Tributário Brasileiro
courses.bio: Fundamentos e Estratégias Legais para Reduzir Impostos e Otimizar a Gestão Fiscal Corporativa
objectives: Conceitos e Definições de Planejamento Tributário: Compreensão das estratégias para reduzir impostos de forma legal e ética.
Tipos de Planejamento Tributário: Diferenças entre planejamento operacional, estratégico, preventivo e corretivo.
Estrutura Tributária no Brasil: Análise dos principais tributos e dos regimes de tributação no Brasil.
Regimes de Tributação: Diferenças entre Lucro Real, Lucro Presumido e Simples Nacional.
Benefícios Fiscais: Identificação de incentivos fiscais federais, estaduais e municipais.
Compliance e Governança Tributária: Importância da conformidade fiscal e gestão de riscos tributários.
requirements: Não há pré-requisitos formais para participar do curso de Planejamento Tributário, tornando-o acessível a uma ampla gama de profissionais interessados em adquirir ou aprimorar conhecimentos nessa área. No entanto, é altamente recomendado que os participantes tenham uma base mínima em contabilidade e estejam familiarizados com os principais tributos empresariais no Brasil, como IRPJ, CSLL, ICMS, PIS e COFINS. Essa familiaridade permitirá um melhor aproveitamento dos conteúdos e facilitará a aplicação prática dos conhecimentos adquiridos.

Embora o curso seja projetado para atender tanto iniciantes quanto profissionais experientes, ele será particularmente útil para aqueles que já atuam nas áreas financeira, tributária, controladoria ou auditoria. A experiência prévia nesses campos ajuda os alunos a contextualizar os conceitos apresentados, compreender melhor as estratégias fiscais discutidas e implementar com mais eficácia as técnicas de planejamento tributário em suas empresas.
courses.description:
Descrição do Curso
O curso de Fundamentos do Planejamento Tributário oferece uma visão sobre o sistema tributário Brasileiro. Ele capacita os participantes a explorar incentivos fiscais, otimizar a gestão de tributos e adotar práticas que melhorem a eficiência financeira das empresas. Ideal para profissionais que desejam combinar conformidade regulatória com vantagem competitiva, o curso oferece uma visão abrangente das possibilidades e cuidados na gestão fiscal, permitindo decisões mais seguras e rentáveis.


Para quem é o curso?
O curso é destinado a gestores financeiros, contadores, advogados tributaristas, empresários, e profissionais de controladoria e auditoria que buscam aprimorar habilidades na gestão fiscal. Ele também atende aqueles que desejam estratégias para reduzir a carga tributária de forma legal e ética, otimizando os recursos financeiros da empresa e garantindo o cumprimento das obrigações fiscais.


O que você vai aprender?
Os participantes aprenderão:
Conceitos e Definições de Planejamento Tributário
Identificação de oportunidades fiscais legítimas.
Otimização fiscal de tributos como IRPJ, CSLL, ICMS, PIS e COFINS.
Entendimento sobre os regimes tributários mais vantajosos (Simples Nacional, Lucro Presumido e Lucro Real).
Boas práticas para lidar com o fisco.
Como evitar riscos fiscais e manter conformidade regulatória.
Ferramentas analíticas e modelos estratégicos para redução da carga tributária.
O que esperar do curso?
Um conteúdo detalhado, incluindo estratégias para redução de impostos.
Abordagem ética e legal em todas as técnicas apresentadas.
Desenvolvimento de habilidades para aplicar benefícios fiscais de forma eficaz.
Orientação para lidar com armadilhas comuns na gestão tributária.
Material de suporte, como exercícios para fixar o conhecimento.
O que não esperar do curso?
Simplificações que ignorem as nuances da legislação tributária.
Métodos ou técnicas que estejam fora dos limites da legalidade e ética.
Garantias absolutas de resultados, pois a aplicação depende do contexto individual de cada empresa.

courses.title: Income Tax Planning and Filing in India: Tax Optimization
courses.bio: Master the Indian income tax system with practical strategies for tax planning, exemptions, and filing returns
objectives: Understand the tax structure of India, including income tax slabs, the importance of tax, and the rationale behind different tax rates.
Gain an overview of income tax law and the definitions used in taxation, such as "gross income," "taxable income," and "exemptions."
Learn the step-by-step process of filing income tax returns, understanding how to plan taxes effectively and avoid common mistakes.
Dive deep into tax planning strategies, including tax management, tax evasion, and distinguishing between tax planning and tax management.
Explore special exemptions, including those for agricultural income and how to handle income from house property, salary, and other sources like gifts or divide
Gain practical experience through numerical examples and case studies, covering common tax scenarios and complex income types.
Understand the tax implications of capital gains and the clubbing of income rules, enabling students to plan their finances efficiently.
Learn how to make use of important deductions (e.g., Section 80C, 80D, 80DDB) and explore strategies for tax optimization.
By the end of the course, students will have the knowledge and confidence to navigate the Indian income tax system

requirements: Basic Knowledge of Finance: A fundamental understanding of finance and accounting concepts, such as income, expenses, and profits, will be helpful.
Understanding of Indian Taxation System: While not mandatory, familiarity with the basic structure of India's taxation system would be beneficial.
Interest in Tax Planning and Personal Finance: This course is ideal for those looking to improve their personal or business financial planning and tax management skills.
No Prior Expertise in Taxation Required: This course is designed for beginners and intermediate learners, so prior experience with tax laws or filing is not a prerequisite.
courses.description:
Introduction:
This course offers an in-depth exploration of the Income Tax framework in India, equipping learners with practical knowledge on tax planning, filing, and the application of various exemptions. Whether you are a beginner looking to understand tax laws or an aspiring tax professional, this course provides the essential tools and strategies for tax management and optimization. With clear guidance on each aspect of the tax process, this course is perfect for anyone seeking to gain expertise in personal and business tax planning.
Section 1: Introduction to Income Tax
The course begins with an overview of the Indian tax system, including the various tax slabs and the income tax law in India. Students will explore the core principles behind taxation, including the reason for tax structures and how they help maintain fiscal stability in the economy. The section highlights the importance of understanding tax obligations and tax rates for individuals and businesses.
Section 2: Tax Definitions and Filing
In this section, learners will delve into the fundamental definitions in taxation, covering terms like "gross income", "taxable income", and "deductions". They will understand the steps involved in tax planning and how to navigate the process of filing income tax returns. The section is designed to guide individuals through the practical aspects of filing taxes, ensuring they grasp the essential paperwork and legal terminologies.
Section 3: Tax Planning and Exemptions
Tax planning is the focus of this section, where students learn how to differentiate between tax planning, tax evasion, and tax management. Through case studies and examples, they will explore strategies for tax optimization, the different types of tax planning, and the objectives behind effective tax planning. Practical tips on tax planning from an employer's perspective help business owners and HR professionals minimize tax liabilities legally.
Section 4: Agriculture Income and Exemptions
Focusing on agricultural income, this section discusses the five heads of income as defined in the Income Tax Act. Students will gain insights into the exemptions available under agricultural income and understand the complexities of reporting agricultural profits under Indian tax laws.
Section 5: Income from House Property
This section teaches how income from house property is taxed in India. Learners will explore various taxable conditions, including gross annual value and deductions under Section 24. Real-life examples and numerical problems are used to explain how income from house property is computed and how deductions apply to reduce taxable income.
Section 6: Income from Other Sources
This section covers income from other sources, including taxation of gifts, dividends, and interest on securities. Learners will also understand deductions that are not allowed under this head, along with practical examples and numerical problems to solidify their understanding of how to report income from these sources.
Section 7: Clubbing of Income and Capital Gains
The focus here is on clubbing of income rules, which explain how income from different sources may be combined for tax purposes. Additionally, the section covers the taxation of capital gains from the sale of assets, including capital assets and transfers, and offers practical examples of how capital gains are calculated and taxed.
Section 8: Income from Salary
In this section, students will learn the details of income from salary, including taxable salary payments and allowances. Special attention is given to salary payments that are partially taxable and the computation of taxable income from salary. Real-world examples and numerical problems help students apply their knowledge effectively.
Section 9: Income from Profits and Gains of Business or Profession
This section covers income from profits and gains derived from business or profession. It explains how business income is calculated, including allowable deductions and exemptions. The section further elaborates on the tax treatment of various business expenses and gains.
Section 10: Case Laws
Case laws play a significant role in tax decisions. This section reviews key case laws that have shaped income tax jurisprudence in India. Through detailed analysis of judicial decisions, learners will understand how tax laws are applied in real-world scenarios.
Section 11: Numerical on Income from House Property
This section provides practical training on calculating income from house property, using a variety of numerical problems and examples. It covers the concepts of gross annual value, deductions under Section 24, and practical tax computation.
Section 12: Numerical on Income from Salaries
Students will work through a series of numerical exercises on income from salaries, learning how to calculate taxable salary, applicable deductions, and exemptions. The section ensures a hands-on understanding of tax calculation from salary income.
Section 13: Deductions and Tax Planning
The final section focuses on key tax deductions available under Section 80C, 80D, and 80DDB. Learners will explore how to maximize tax savings through strategic planning, understanding the significance of deductions in reducing overall tax liability.
Conclusion:
By the end of this course, students will have a comprehensive understanding of the Indian income tax system and be capable of applying tax planning strategies to minimize tax liabilities. The course will provide practical insights into filing income tax returns, reporting various forms of income, and utilizing tax exemptions and deductions to optimize personal and business finances.
target_audience: Beginners in Taxation: Individuals with little or no prior knowledge of tax laws who want to gain a strong foundation in the Indian income tax system.
Small Business Owners: Entrepreneurs and small business owners who wish to better manage their business’s tax planning and filing obligations.
Students of Finance and Accounting: Aspiring professionals in accounting, finance, and business management who need to understand the practical applications of tax laws.
Tax Professionals: Tax consultants, accountants, and advisors who wish to deepen their knowledge of Indian tax laws and regulations, specifically with respect to exemptions, deductions, and planning.
Working Professionals: Employees looking to optimize their personal income tax planning and learn how to file returns effectively and maximize exemptions.
Anyone Interested in Personal Finance: Individuals seeking to learn how to reduce tax liabilities, understand deductions, and optimize their financial situation in a tax-efficient manner.

courses.title: Konsep Perpajakan di Indonesia
courses.bio: Teori dasar perpajakan, Pajak Bumi dan Bangunan (PBB), Bea Perolehan Hak atas Tanah dan Bangunan (BPHTB), PPN
requirements: Tidak dibutuhkan syarat khusus
courses.description:
Pajak adalah sumber penerimaan negara yang paling utama. Baik tingkat penerimaan pajak, maupun target dari penerimaan pajak itu sendiri terus meningkat dari tahun ke tahun, seiring dengan meningkatnya pengeluaran belanja negara. Dana yang dikumpulkan dari penerimaan pajak tersebut digunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan belanja negara, seperti untuk membangun infrastruktur di seluruh wilayah NKRI, transfer dana desa ke daerah-daerah yang membutuhkan, mensubsidi bahan bakar minyak (BBM), membagikan jaring pengaman sosial untuk warga yang membutuhkan, membayar gaji pegawai negeri sipil (PNS), TNI, Polri, dan lain sebagainya.


Sangat perlu bagi setiap warga negara yang sudah memiliki penghasilan untuk melakukan pembayaran pajak, baik itu penghasilan yang diterima oleh badan usaha (PT, CV, Firma, dll) maupun yang diterima oleh orang pribadi. Pemerintah sudah melakukan sosialisasi terkait pentingnya untuk membayar pajak, akan tetapi mengingat banyaknya jumlah warga negara Indonesia yang tersebar dari Sabang hingga Merauke, membuat sosialisasi ini menjadi belum merata.


Perpajakan selalu menjadi isu yang penting sekaligus strategis, baik di Indonesia maupun di negara-negara lain. Materi Taxation kali ini akan menjelaskan berbagai hal yang berhubungan dengan dunia perpajakan dasar di Indonesia, mulai dari teori dasar perpajakan, Pajak Bumi dan Bangunan (PBB), Bea Perolehan Hak atas Tanah dan Bangunan (BPHTB), Pajak Pertambahan Nilai (PPN), Pajak Penjualan atas Barang Mewah (PPnBM), PPN atas Kegiatan Membangun Sendiri, dan PPN untuk Wajib Pajak dengan kriteria tertentu. Tiap-tiap pajak tersebut tidak hanya menjelaskan secara teoritius saja, tetapi juga dengan menggunakan contoh-contoh perhitungan dan ilustrasi kasus perpajakan yang sering terjadi di Indonesia, baik di dunia kerja maupun dalam kehidupan sehari-hari sebagai seorang Wajib Pajak.


Untuk pelaporan SPT Masa Orang Pribadi, penghitungan atas PBB dan BPHTB, adalah jenis pajak yang dapat melekat pada Wajib Pajak Orang Pribadi, sedangkan untuk PPN dan PPnBM juga dapat melekat pada Wajib Pajak Orang Pribadi, terutama sebagai pihak yang dipungut/membayar PPN tersebut, meskipun tidak semua Wajib Pajak Orang Pribadi tersebut memiliki kewajiban untuk melaporkan PPN setiap bulannya.


Aspek-aspek perpajakan diatas akan dijabarkan secara up to date, dengan berdasarkan pada tarif pajak yang berlaku saat ini, khususnya setelah diterbitkannya Undang-undang Omnimbus Law, maupun Undang-undang Harmonisasi Peraturan Perpajakan (UU HPP), dengan menggunakan bahasa yang ringan dan mudah untuk dipahami bagi para pendengar dan pembacanya.


Dengan lebih mengerti dan lebih memahami dasar-dasar dan filosofi perpajakan, serta terampil dalam menghitung pajak, dan terampil dalam melakukan pelaporan pajak, diharapkan para generasi muda di masa mendatang akan menjadi generasi muda yang patuh dan sadar akan pentingnya menjalankan kewajiban perpajakan.
target_audience: Student yang ingin mempelajari perpajakan di Indonesia

2023年10月1日から「インボイス制度」がはじまります。


個人事業主やフリーランス、副業ワーカーの中には消費税の免税事業者も多いですが、何となく「インボイス登録しないといけないのかな？」と考えていませんか？


インボイス登録することで消費税の納税が必要になるだけでなく、正しい向き合い方を理解していないと、経理の負担も大幅に増えてしまう可能性があります！


「免税事業者を続ける」という選択肢を諦めてしまうのではなく、以下の手順で論理的に考えてみましょう。

courses.title: Goods and Services Tax Registration
courses.bio: A simple course on GST registration process in India
requirements: Basic knowledge of accounts
Knowledge of using PC with internet
courses.description:
Goods and Services Tax (GST) is an indirect tax law which came into existence throughout India on 01st July, 2017. GST is a comprehensive, multi-stage, destination-based tax that will be levied on every value addition of a product supply chain. It is a tax levied at every point of sale.
GST has effected businesses of all types in India. It has made compulsory for a large number of businesses to register under it. Without registration, a person or a business entity can neither collect tax from his customers nor claim any input Tax Credit of tax paid by his suppliers.
This course is aimed for people who need a guide to complete the registration of their business entity under the GST law. This course will also give you a basic idea about this new law.
target_audience: Anyone who is interested to know about Goods and Services Tax in India
Anyone who is interested in registering under GST in India

Changes regarding shareholding being disclosed on your ITR14 from 2023 onwards and the Share Register Form

courses.title: GST Mastery: Understanding Goods and Services Tax in India
courses.bio: Master GST concepts with ease—navigate tax regulations like a pro and ensure compliance for your business!
objectives: Understand Key GST Concepts: Learn the fundamentals of GST, including taxable events, scope of supply, and its impact on business operations.
Master Taxable Supplies: Explore different types of taxable supplies, such as goods and services, and how they are classified under GST.
Navigate GST Registration and Compliance: Gain insights into the process of registration, the role of taxable persons, and the responsibilities of businesses.
Apply Reverse Charge Mechanism (RCM): Understand how reverse charge works, including its applicability to unregistered persons and specific goods and services.
Master Input Tax Credit (ITC): Learn how to claim and utilize input tax credit, including its limitations and the proper way to reverse credits.
Value the Supply Accurately: Understand how to determine the value of taxable supplies, accounting for discounts, related persons, and market value.
Grasp the Role of Composition Scheme: Understand the composition levy, conditions, and its tax benefits for small businesses.
Analyze Time and Place of Supply: Learn the rules for determining the time and place of supply, an essential aspect for ensuring correct tax liability.
Explore Taxability in Various Scenarios: Examine various taxability cases including intra-state and inter-state supplies, and the taxation of goods.
Understand Job Work and Exemptions: Explore special provisions for job workers, exemptions available for specific sectors, the process of clearance of goods.
This course aims to provide students with a solid foundation in GST, enabling them to effectively manage and comply with GST regulations.
requirements: Basic Understanding of Taxation: Familiarity with basic taxation concepts (such as VAT, service tax, or income tax) will be helpful but not mandatory.
Interest in Business or Finance: This course is ideal for those working in or planning to enter fields related to accounting, finance, business management, or taxation.
No Prior GST Knowledge Required: The course is designed for beginners, so no prior GST knowledge is necessary. The concepts will be explained step-by-step.
Access to a Computer and Internet: As this course involves online learning, students will need a stable internet connection and access to a computer or smartphone.
Eagerness to Learn: An enthusiasm to grasp the complexities of GST laws, rules, and their practical application in business is key for success in this course.
courses.description:
Course Introduction:
This in-depth GST certification course is designed to provide a thorough understanding of Goods and Services Tax (GST) in India. The course covers all critical aspects of GST, from its basic principles and taxable events to complex topics like input tax credit, job work, and reverse charge mechanisms. Whether you're a finance professional, entrepreneur, or student, this course will help you master the intricacies of GST, enabling you to navigate tax laws with confidence.
Section 1: GST 01 - Taxable Event and Scope of Supply
This section introduces the foundational concept of GST—taxable events and the scope of supply. Students will learn about the nature of taxable events under GST, how supply is defined, and how various activities come under GST's purview. Practical illustrations will help clarify the nuances of these concepts, preparing students to better understand the operational aspects of GST.
Section 2: GST 02 - Meaning of Goods and Services and Chargeability
In this section, we delve into the essential elements that define goods and services under GST. The course explains the chargeability of GST, focusing on different types of supplies, including intra-state and inter-state supplies. The section also covers the taxability of various products like petroleum and composite supplies, providing clarity on their GST obligations.
Section 3: GST 03 - Composition Levy
Here, students will gain insights into the Composition Levy scheme under GST. This section explains the composition tax rate, the conditions for eligibility, and the process involved in opting for or withdrawing from the scheme. The section also includes illustrative examples to help students understand the benefits and limitations of the Composition Levy for small taxpayers.
Section 4: GST 04 - Reverse Charge Mechanism
The Reverse Charge Mechanism (RCM) is a critical aspect of GST, and this section offers an in-depth explanation. It focuses on the concept of reverse charge, the specified goods and services covered under RCM, and the registration requirements for unregistered persons. Students will learn through practical examples to understand how RCM affects different stakeholders in the supply chain.
Section 5: GST 05 - Time of Supply
Time of Supply plays a vital role in determining the taxable event for GST. This section explains the statutory provisions related to time of supply for goods and services, both under forward and reverse charges. The course also includes examples illustrating how to calculate the time of supply and deal with changes in the rate of tax.
Section 6: GST 06 - Place of Supply
Understanding the place of supply is essential for determining the applicable GST rates. This section covers provisions for determining the place of supply for goods and services. Topics include supply of services in different scenarios, such as restaurant services, transportation, and events, with practical illustrations for easy comprehension.
Section 7: GST 07 - Taxable Person and Registration
This section focuses on who qualifies as a taxable person under GST and the process of GST registration. It covers the concept of aggregate turnover, liability for registration, and the steps involved in registration. Additionally, it explains special cases such as non-resident taxable persons and electronic commerce operators.
Section 8: GST 08 - Job Work
Job work is a significant component of the manufacturing process under GST, and this section explores the term "job worker" in detail. It covers the removal of goods for job work, the clearances of waste and scrap, and the registration requirements for job workers. Practical examples help to reinforce these concepts.
Section 9: GST 09 - Input Tax Credit
This section provides a comprehensive overview of Input Tax Credit (ITC) under GST, focusing on the eligibility criteria, the process of claiming ITC, and the documentation required. It also explains the conditions under which ITC can be claimed and reversed, with examples to demonstrate various scenarios.
Section 10: GST 10 - Determination of Value of Supply
Understanding the value of supply is critical for calculating GST liability. This section explains how to determine the value of taxable supplies, including the transaction value and rules for related persons. It also discusses the inclusion of taxes, duties, and fees in the value of supply, with practical examples to illustrate different valuation methods.
Conclusion:
By the end of this comprehensive GST course, you will have a deep understanding of the various concepts and provisions under GST. You'll be equipped to handle GST-related queries, comply with regulations, and take strategic decisions for businesses. Whether you're looking to enhance your career or ensure that your business remains compliant, this course provides the essential tools and knowledge you need.
target_audience: Accounting and Finance Professionals: Chartered accountants, tax consultants, financial analysts, and accountants who wish to deepen their understanding of GST and apply it to their clients' needs or their own businesses.

Entrepreneurs and Business Owners: Individuals running small, medium, or large businesses who need to understand GST compliance, tax filing, and efficient tax planning to ensure their business is GST-compliant.

Tax and Audit Professionals: Auditors, tax advisors, and legal professionals who want to expand their expertise in the GST domain and advise clients effectively on tax planning, deductions, exemptions, and tax liability.
Government Officials: Employees working in tax-related government departments who need to stay up-to-date with the latest GST rules, regulations, and procedural changes.
Students Pursuing Finance or Business Studies: Students of finance, accounting, or business management who want to gain a practical understanding of GST laws and taxation systems in India.
General Public Interested in Taxation: Individuals looking to understand the impact of GST on goods and services and how it affects the economy and businesses.

courses.title: Transfer Pricing Masterclass (Part 1)
courses.bio: TP Legal Framework
objectives: Legal Framework
Arm's Length Principle
Functional Analysis

Critically evaluate and compare different transfer pricing rules and regulations in key countries.
Deal with complex legal concepts and key case law related to Transfer Pricing.
Explain and critique sections relating to Transfer Pricing within the United Nations and OECD Model Tax Convention, with specific reference to Articles 7 to 12
Analyse, critically reflect on and synthesise complex concepts relating to the Arm’s length principle.
Explain the term "Functional Analysis" as set out in the OECD Guidelines and provide a critical outline of the vsteps required to conduct a Functional Analysis.

Module 1 - TP Legal Framework: TP Legal Framework - Part 1: Back Ground to legal Systems
TP Legal Framework - Part 2 - Finding Case Law online
TP Legal Framework - Part 3 - Double Tax Treaties/ Agreements
TP Legal Framework - Part 4 - OECD TP Guidelines & UN Practical TP
TP Legal Framework - Part 5 - In-country legislation
TP Legal Framework - Part 6 - Other treaties & legislation

requirements: Knowledge of International Taxation principles
Basic understanding of Transfer Pricing
courses.description:
The aim of this module is to highlight the legal framework that covers Transfer Pricing. Transfer Pricing touches multinational corporations, working in multiple jurisdictions. This module will provide the student with an overview of the tools needed to assess the the legal environment of a specific jurisdiction when applying the transfer pricing principles. This is a very broad module, however, it lays the foundation for the rest of the course. The appreciation of operating within an ethical framework and specifically within the Transfer Pricing environment is discussed with the students.
The module also covers the very important Arm’s Length Principle and Functional Analysis, laying further groundwork for the rest of the course.
The "Arm's-Length Principle" of transfer pricing states that the amount charged by one related party to another for a given product must be the same as if the parties were not related. An arm's-length price for a transaction is therefore what the price of that transaction would be on the open market.
The functional analysis is used for transfer pricing purposes. It analyses the functions performed (taking into account assets used and risks assumed) by associated enterprises in a transaction.

requirements: पाठ्यक्रम हिंदी/उर्दू भाषा में है।
courses.description: पाठ्यक्रम में व्यक्ति की आवासीय स्थिति शामिल है। जिसे एनआरआई कहा जाता है। इसमें एनआरआई की कर योग्य आय के बारे में सब कुछ शामिल है। एनआरआई की सकल कुल आय पर उपलब्ध सभी कटौतियां। उनके पूंजीगत लाभ की गणना और छूट उपलब्ध है। यह कोर्स एनआरआई, एनआरआई, टैक्स प्रोफेशनल्स और सीए/सीएमए/सीएस/कॉमर्स के छात्रों के लिए बनाया गया है। 2 प्रकार के बैंक खातों की संक्षिप्त चर्चा जो एनआरआई खोल सकते हैं यानी एनआरई का मतलब अनिवासी बाहरी खाता और एनआरओ का मतलब अनिवासी साधारण खाता है। इस कोर्स में किरायेदारों के दायित्वों को शामिल किया गया है जो एनआरआई को किराए का भुगतान करने जा रहे हैं। एनआरआई के लिए लागू टीडीएस दरें। इसमें हाउस प्रॉपर्टी से एनआरआई की आय शामिल है। ऐसी आय पर धारा 24 के तहत उपलब्ध कटौती। फिर इसमें प्रतिभूतियों की बिक्री के साथ-साथ संपत्तियों की बिक्री के कारण होने वाला पूंजीगत लाभ भी शामिल है। लॉन्ग टर्म कैपिटल गेन और शॉर्ट टर्म कैपिटल गेन। कर के बोझ को कम करने के लिए निवेश के अवसर। धारा ५४, धारा ५४एफ और धारा ५४ईसी पर संक्षिप्त विवरण। धारा 195 जिसके तहत टैक्स काटा जाना है। टीडीएस दर कम करने के लिए धारा 197। यह सेक्शन 80C के तहत, सेक्शन 80D के तहत, सेक्शन 80E के तहत, सेक्शन 80G के तहत और सेक्शन 80TTA के तहत निवेश के अवसरों को निर्दिष्ट करता है। एनआरआई पर आयकर रिटर्न दाखिल करने की बाध्यता। विभिन्न प्रकार के फॉर्म जैसे फॉर्म 15CB, फॉर्म 15CA, फॉर्म 13, फॉर्म 16A आदि पर संक्षिप्त चर्चा।
target_audience: यह कोर्स एनआरआई, एनआरआई, टैक्स प्रोफेशनल्स और सीए/सीएमए/सीएस/कॉमर्स के छात्रों के लिए बनाया गया है।

requirements: Understanding about basics of transfer pricing
courses.description:
Gain a profound understanding of transfer pricing and its practical applications through this comprehensive course led by Ajit Kumar Jain, a seasoned global transfer pricing expert with over 14 years of experience in the field. This course delves into the intricate world of transfer pricing, focusing on three key areas: Value Chain Analysis (VCA), Transfer Pricing Policy, and Operational Transfer Pricing (OTP).
In the Value Chain Analysis section, you will learn how to examine the entire production process, identify value creation within each segment, and analyze the interdependencies between functions across a multinational group. This holistic approach provides insights into aligning transfer pricing outcomes with value creation, which is crucial for influencing strategic decisions in global operations.
The Transfer Pricing Policy segment will guide you through the critical components of designing and implementing effective transfer pricing policies. You will explore functional and economic analyses, practical pricing mechanisms, and robust documentation frameworks to ensure compliance with global regulations and mitigate risks of double taxation and tax disputes.
In the Operational Transfer Pricing module, you will discover how to transform transfer pricing policies into living processes. This section covers key process issues, level 3 process mapping, and technology development, ensuring that transfer pricing is correctly implemented in systems, processes, and invoices. You will learn strategies to bridge the gap between strategic intent and day-to-day reality, enhancing operational efficiency and risk management.
This course is ideal for finance professionals, tax consultants, and business strategists aiming to leverage transfer pricing as a strategic tool. Whether you are looking to optimize global tax positions, manage risks, or enhance operational efficiency, this course offers the insights and strategies you need to succeed. Through real-world case studies, practical examples, and downloadable resources, you will gain the knowledge and skills to apply transfer pricing principles effectively in your organization.

requirements: No Prerequisites required
courses.description:
This Course is open to taxpayers those want to file Form ITR-U: Updated Return U/s 139(8A) Income Tax Act, 1961
ITR-U is a form that allows taxpayers to correct errors or omissions on their ITRs up to two years from the end of the relevant assessment year to update their return. The ITR-U form is a rescue for those who have not filed their ITR or made inaccurate and false entries while filing their income tax returns. Section 139(8A) under the Income Tax Act allows you a chance to update your ITR within two years i.e. 24 months from the end of the relevant assessment year.
Prescribed Date to file Form ITR-U
An updated return can be filed at any time within 24 months from the end of the relevant assessment year. For instance, for AY 2023-24, you missed the revised/ belated return filing window, you can file an ITR-U after the end of the assessment year, i.e. 31 March 2024 but within two years from there, i.e. 31 March 2026.
Who is eligible to file Form ITR-U
Any person who forget to file return and has made an error or omitted certain income details in any of the following returns is eligible to file an updated return:
Original return of income, or
Belated return, or
Revised return
target_audience: everyone who is interested to learn about Updated Return ITR-U found this course content valuable

Eğitimde Dahilde İşleme Rejimi çerçevesinde Ticaret Bakanlığı İhracat Genel Müdürlüğü tarafından verilen Dahilde İşleme İzin Belgesi 'nin detayları anlatılmıştır. Dahilde İşleme Rejimi ile ihracatçı firmalara, hammadde, yardımcı madde ya da ambalaj malzemesi temin etmek suretiyle ihracatı artırmak, döviz akışını sağlamak, uluslararası arenada rekabet gücü kazandırmak ihracat pazarını geliştirmek amaçlanmaktadır. Dünya piyasa fiyatlarından gümrük muafiyetli olarak, Ticaret Politikası önlemlerine tabi olmaksızın, ihraç ürünün üretimi için gerekli olan ve fiyat ve/veya kalite bakımından yurtiçi veya yurtdışı piyasalardan temin edilebilen, hammadde, yardımcı madde ve ambalaj malzemeleri için ekonomik etkili bir gümrük rejimidir. DİR çerçevesinde ihracatçıya sağlanan birçok avantaj bulunmaktadır. En önemli avantajı çeşitli vergi yükümlülüklerinden muafiyet sağlanmasıdır.
İzleyeceğiniz eğitimde, Dahilde İşleme Rejimi ne demektir, belge nasıl alınabilir, firmalara sağladığı vergi ve diğer avantajlar nelerdir, taahhüt hesabının kapatılmasına kadar giden tüm süreçleri detaylı bir şekilde öğrenmiş olacaksınız.
Bu eğitimin farkı, çeşitli yerlerden ulaşılabilecek eğitimlere nazaran karmaşıklıktan uzak, daha anlaşılır olması ve rejim ile ilgili başvuru esnasında hesaplamaların nasıl yapılabileceğine dair detayların anlatılıyor olmasıdır. Eğitim içeriğinde belge alınırken yapılması gerekli kapasite hesaplarına yer verilmiştir. Bu konu genellikle eğitimlerde anlatılmaz, yüzeysel geçilir.
Bu eğitim, firmaların ihracat departmanında çalışanlar, firma sahibi, lojistik, dış ticaret, muhasebe, gümrük sektöründe çalışan veya teşviklere ilgi duyan öğrenciler için hazırlanmıştır. Katkı ve faydalı olması dileğiyle.
target_audience: Bu eğitim, firmaların ihracat departmanında çalışanlar, firma sahibi, lojistik, dış ticaret, muhasebe, gümrük sektöründe çalışan veya teşviklere ilgi duyan öğrenciler için hazırlanmıştır.

courses.description:
This course will focus on tax preparation related to rental real property.
We will look at each new concept from multiple angles, starting with a presentation discussing the topic and then looking at examples to better understand the concepts in action.
The example section will use tax forms to work problems and an accounting equation method using Excel so learners will understand the impact on the actual tax return and visualize the concepts using a tax formula.
We will start with an introduction to residential rental property and go over what’s new.
Learners will understand what constitutes rental income and expenses for a situation where there is no personal use of the dwelling. We will understand when to deduct and what the most common deductions are.
Learners will understand the concept of points and the tax implications.
The course will discuss the concept of depreciation, providing examples using tax forms and worksheets to solidify the information.
We will discuss the concept of basis and how it is calculated. Learners will understand what rental property can be depreciated and well as when depreciation should begin and end. The course will outline depreciation methods and how to determine the proper one for a particular situation.
We will also discuss reporting rental income, expenses, and losses. Learners will know which forms to use. The course will cover Schedule E and provide example presentations demonstrating the form.
We will also discuss loss limitation rules.

courses.title: Zolltarif: Einreihung von Maschinenteilen des Abschnitt XVI
courses.bio: Anmerkung 2 zu Abschnitt XVI
objectives: Zolltarifrecht: Einreihung von Maschinenteilen des Abschnitt XVI
Maßgebende Rechtsvorschriften kennenlernen
Anmerkung 2 zu Abschnitt XVI des Zolltarifs verstehen und nutzen
Zolltarifliche Definition "Teile"

Zolltarifrecht: Einreihung von Maschinen: Zolltarif: Anmerkung 2 Abs. 1 zu Abschnitt XVI

requirements: Für Anfänger, Fortgeschrittene und Experten geeignet
courses.description:
Die richtige Einreihung von Maschinenteilen in den Zolltarif ist ein bedeutsamer und rechtlich anspruchsvoller Vorgang für nahezu alle Bereiche der Wareneinfuhr und -ausfuhr. Die Einreihung von Maschinenteilen wird durch eine Anmerkung zum Harmonisierten System geregelt – die Anmerkung 2 zum Abschnitt XVI (Kapitel 84 und 85) des Zolltarifs.
Diese Anmerkung findet weltweit, in allen Ländern, die am Harmonisierten System der Weltzollorganisation teilnehmen, Anwendung.
Die Anmerkung 2 zum Abschnitt XVI stellt sich als eine komplexe „weltumspannende“ Rechtsgrundlage dar, die eine strukturierte Anwendung voraussetzt, um Fehler bei der Teileeinreihung zu vermeiden.
In diesem Kurs möchten wir Ihnen systematisch den Aufbau der Anmerkung 2 zum Abschnitt XVI anhand zahlreicher veranschaulichender Beispiele darstellen und erklären, damit Sie die Fertigkeit erlangen, Maschinenteile richtig in den Zolltarif einzureihen.
Neben der Abgrenzung zwischen „Teilen“ und „Zubehör“ beleuchten wir auch die zahlreichen Ausnahmen (Teile mit allgemeiner Verwendungsmöglichkeit), die beachtet werden müssen, bevor Anmerkung 2 zum Abschnitt XVI überhaupt Anwendung finden kann.
Die richtige Einreihung von Waren in den Zolltarif ist elementar für folgenden Zollprozesse. Werden Waren falsch eingereiht, kommen ggf. die falschen Zollsätze zur Anwendung, oder mögliche Verbote und Beschränkungen werden aufgrund der Falscheinreihung nicht erkannt. Die Tarifnummer kann Auswirkung also Auswirkung auf die Abgabenerhebung und auch auf die Zulässigkeit der Einfuhr haben. Auch im Ausfuhrverfahren und bei der Präferenzkalkulation ist die richtige Einreihung immens wichtig.

courses.description:
Welcome to "Mastering QuickBooks Online for US Income Tax Optimization" - your one-stop course for leveraging QuickBooks Online to efficiently manage and optimize your income tax obligations. Designed for freelancers, small business owners, and anyone seeking a robust understanding of QuickBooks Online in the context of U.S. income tax law, this comprehensive course offers practical insights and hands-on exercises to help you become proficient in using QuickBooks for your tax needs.
Key Learning Objectives:
1. Master Mileage Tracking Tool: QuickBooks Online's Mileage Tracking tool can significantly simplify your automobile-related tax deductions. We'll break down the process of logging and categorizing miles, while also explaining the intricacies of tax law related to automobile deductions. This practical understanding can be crucial for maximizing your automobile deductions and ensuring tax compliance.
2. Explore Home Office Deductions: Learn how to accurately track home office expenses for income tax deductions. The course includes a comparison of different methods, along with a comprehensive review of the relevant tax laws. By the end of this section, you'll be able to select and implement the most beneficial method for your specific situation.
3. Track and Upload Receipts: Discover how to capture, upload, and manage your receipts in QuickBooks Online. We'll also demonstrate how to use these receipts to record transactions or attach them to existing transactions. This module will significantly enhance your record-keeping skills, making tax season less daunting.
target_audience: Freelancers: Those who manage their own taxes and are looking for ways to maximize deductions.
Small Business Owners: Those who need to navigate U.S. income tax law and manage their financial records efficiently.
Accountants and Bookkeepers: Professionals who work with freelancers and small businesses, and want to enhance their skills in QuickBooks Online.
Tax Consultants: Those wanting to offer their clients more value by understanding how to optimize income taxes using QuickBooks Online.
Individuals Planning to Start a Business: Those who want to understand income tax optimization before starting their own venture.
Students in Finance or Accounting: Those wanting to augment their studies with practical knowledge and understanding of a commonly used financial tool.
Anyone Handling Personal Finances: Individuals seeking better ways to manage and track their expenses for tax purposes.

courses.description:
Olá, seja bem-vindo ao curso online Regimes tributários comparados - Domine e escolha o melhor.
Eu sou o professor Antônio Marteson e te garanto que você vai aprender de verdade sobre cada um dos regimes tributários, fazer comparações complexas e escolher um deles para qualquer empresa.
Para quem é esse curso?
Esse curso é para estudantes e profissionais de Contabilidade, Direito, Administração, Economia e afins. Pessoas que já estão na área ou pretendem iniciar.
Por que fazer esse curso?
Esse curso vai do básico ao avançado, inclusive ouso afirmar que o conteúdo é avançado do que muitos cursos de graduações que abordam o tema por cima superficialmente. Nesse curso será abordado assuntos detalhados e específicos de cada um dos regimes tributários num nível muito alto, você perceberá al longo das aulas. Esse curso também pode ser uma boa oportunidade para a prestação de serviços nessa área, na consultoria de escolha de regime tributário.
O que vou aprender de verdade?
Você vai ter a capacidade técnica de responder a uma empresa qual a melhor opção de regime tributário e cobrar por isso.
Ou poderá trabalhar em parceria com advogados e contadores que muitas vezes precisam dessa análise e acabam terceirizando.


Vantagens de fazer esse curso online.
- Tem certificado. Após o fim do curso você pode baixar.
- Acesso vitalício. O curso é seu para sempre.
- Tira dúvidas com o instrutor. Pode me fazer perguntas.
- 30 dias para solicitar reembolso.
- Conteúdo de ótima qualidade, caso não gosto, solicite reembolso sem nenhum problema.
- Você acessa quando e onde quiser
- Esse curso não tem questionários. Todo o conteúdo complementar deve ser lido no material que foi deixado para baixar.
- Todos os exercícios necessários para o aprendizado serão respondidos em vídeos, não tendo assim simulados.


Metodologia de ensino.
Eu apresento a tela do meu computador, mostro os slides, faço as leituras, explicações, comentários e exemplos práticos de como acontece na realidade.
Eu ensino todo o curso do modo lógico e estruturado, ou seja, o ideal é que você assista aula por aula, sem pular, a não ser que já domine todo o conteúdo daquela aula.
Venha comigo, faça sua matrícula e mude o patamar de seu conhecimento.

courses.title: Perpajakan untuk UMKM di Indonesia
courses.bio: Pajak, UMKM, PPh Pasal 21, PPh Pasal 26
requirements: Memahami konsep dasar akuntansi
courses.description:
Perkembangan usaha mikro, kecil dan menengah (UMKM) di Indonesia semakin meningkat setiap tahunnya. Kehadiran UMKM dinilai mampu meratakan perekonomian dan berperan besar dalam penerimaan pajak di Indonesia. UMKM memiliki kewajiban perpajakan, baik pajak penghasilan maupun pajak final.
Course ini bertujuan untuk menjelaskan dasar peraturan perpajakan bagi UMKM, tata cara perpajakan dan kewajiban perpajakan bagi UMKM. Materi yang akan dibahas adalah terdiri dari sepuluh topik dasar dari Perpajakan untuk UMKM dengan bentuk pembelajaran berisi materi dan contoh kasus atau ilustrasi kasus yang disertai dengan cara menghitung dan cara melaporkan pajak yang sesuai dengan Undang-undang Perpajakan yang berlaku.
Adapun area topik yang akan dibahas dalam materi pembelajaran ini adalah: Gambaran Umum Perpajakan, Prosedur Pajak di Indonesia, Subjek Pajak dan Objek Pajak, Gambaran Umum Pajak Penghasilan dan PPh Final, Gambaran Umum Subjek Pajak dan Objek Pajak, Perhitungan Pajak PPh Pasal 21, Penerapan PPh pasal 21, Gambaran Umum Subjek Pajak dan Objek Pajak, Perhitungan Pajak PPh Pasal 26, Pajak Penghasilan untuk UMKM (PP23/tahun 2018), Pelaporan Wajib Pajak Badan Penghasilan Bruto Tertentu (PP23/Tahun 2018), Pelaporan Wajib Pajak Orang Pribadi Penghasilan Bruto Tertentu (PP23/Tahun 2018). Setelah mempelajari mata kuliah ini, diharapkan pembelajar dapat memperoleh pengetahuan mendasar Perpajakan untuk menghitung, membayar dan melaporkan kewajiban perpajakan untuk UMKM.
target_audience: Student yang ingin belajar perpajakan untuk UMKM di Indonesia

courses.title: Einreihung in den Zolltarif - Allgemeine Vorschriften
courses.bio: Basiswissen Allgemeine Vorschriften
objectives: Grundlagen des Zolltarifrechts verstehen
Was wird mit den Allgemeine Vorschriften 1-6 geregelt
Auflösung von Konkurrenzen bei der zolltariflichen Einreihung
Einreihungen von Mischungen, zerlegten Waren, Warenzusammenstellungen und Umschließungen
Einreihung von Waren, die aus verschiedenen Stoffen bestehen
requirements: Anfänger und Fortgeschrittene
courses.description:
Grundlagen und Basiswissen mit den Allgemeinen Vorschriften für die erfolgreiche Zolltarifierung!
Die richtige Einreihung in den Zolltarif ist Grundlage für verschiedene Folgeprozesse im Bereich der Zollabfertigung. Die richtige Einreihung in den Zolltarif bestimmt z.B. über  die Höhe des Zoll-, Umsatzsteuersatzes, über handelspolitische Maßnahmen, Verbote und Beschränkungen, etc..
Mit der korrekten Einreihung Ihrer Ware schaffen Sie die Basis für die rechtskonforme Abwicklung Ihrer Zollprozesse und vermeiden Verzögerungen im Abfertigungsprozess bzw. auch mögliche Sanktionen durch die Behörden.
Mit anderen Worten die Zolltarifierung ist das Herz Ihrer Zollprozesse!
Das Tutorial zeigt Ihnen Schritt für Schritt wie Sie sich der Thematik Zolltarifierung nähern und verstehen. Neben den einschlägigen Vorschriften wird Ihnen anhand von Beispielen die Anwendung der Rechtsvorschriften erläutert.
Haben Sie sich schon immer die Frage gestellt, ob ein Zollstock als Ware aus Holz in das Kapitel 44 oder als Messinstrument in das Kapitel 90 des Zolltarifs eingereiht wird?
Wann und wie kommen die Allgemeinen Vorschriften zum Einsatz?
Was passiert, wenn meine Ware nicht namentlich im Zolltarif genannt ist, wie geht man dann vor?
Wie werden gemischte Waren oder Waren, die aus verschiedenen Bestandteilen bestehen eingereiht?
Wie wird eine Warenzusammenstellung (Ware besteht aus verschiedenen Komponenten - Kit) richtig tarifiert?
Wie werden die Umschließungen /Verpackungen zu meinen Waren tarifiert?
Wie werden mögliche Konkurrenzen bei der rechtlichen Beurteilung aufgelöst?
Wie geht man vor?
Im vorliegenden Tutorial erlernen Sie Schritt für Schritt die Anwendung der Allgemeinen Vorschriften und schaffen somit das Fundament für die erfolgreiche Einreihung in den Zolltarif. Nur wenn Sie dieses Grundverständnis verinnerlicht haben, werden Sie auch schwierigere Anwendungsfälle richtig lösen können.
Für die rechtskonforme Tarifierung und somit als Grundlage Ihre nachfolgenden Zollprozesse wie Export, Import und Warenursprung und Präferenzrecht ist es unabdingbar, dass Sie die AV1-6 verinnerlicht haben.


Hinweis: Die rechtliche Einschätzung spiegelt die Auffassung der Ersteller nach bestem Wissen und Gewissen wider und ist rechtlich aber unverbindlich!
target_audience: Mitarbeiter in Zollabteilungen, Zollsachbearbeiter, Zollbroker und Speditionen

courses.title: Steuern Masterkurs: Gewerbesteuer (1)
courses.bio: Lerne die Grundlagen der Gewerbesteuer kennen
objectives: Die Grundlagen der Gewerbesteuer kennenlernen
Die Steuerrecht Masterkurs Kursreihe kennenlernen
Das deutsche Steuerrecht genauer verstehen
Die Steuern eines Gewerbebetriebes kennenlernen
Gewerbesteuer sparen
Gewerbesteuerpflicht vermeiden und Befreiungen nutzen
requirements: Es gibt keine Voraussetzungen für diesen Kurs. Er ist problemlos für Anfänger zu verstehen, da die Grundlagen der Gewerbesteuer erklärt werden.

Es wäre jedoch nur vorteilhaft, wenn Sie vorher meine anderen Steuerrecht Masterkurse besucht hätten, da die deutschen Steuern oft zusammenhängen. Dies ist allerdings kein Muss, sodass dieser Kurs auch ohne das Wissen der anderen Kurse absolviert werden kann.
courses.description:
Jaja, die Gewerbesteuer. Viele Menschen draußen auf der Straße denken sich dazu nur:
"Was ist denn das nun wieder. Zahlen das nicht irgendwie irgendwelche Unternehmen. Mein Chef zahlt das doch glaub ich, oder? Ne, nicht mein Chef, aber mein Arbeitgeber... Der zahlt das doch, oder?"
Die Gewerbesteuer ist eine Unternehmenssteuer, die nur die Unternehmen bezahlen, die ein sogenanntes Gewerbe oder einen Gewerbebetrieb nach § 15 Einkommensteuergesetz führen. Hierfür müssen bestimmte Voraussetzungen erfüllt sein.
Jedoch ist aber den meisten bekannt, dass die Gewerbesteuer eine wichtige Steuer für die Gemeinden/Städte und Kommunen sind. Diese Steuer steht nämlich (zumindest faktisch direkt) nur den Kommunen und nicht dem Bund oder den deutschen Bundesländern zu.


"Nun das ist ja schön und was habe ich damit zutun. Ich habe kein Unternehmen und kein Gewerbe ich mache nur meinen Job und bekomme dafür monatlich ein Gehalt."


Das mögen sich jetzt viele fragen.
Die Gewerbesteuer wird zwar nur von den Gewerbetreibenden bezahlt, aber der Endkonsument trägt es faktisch mit. In der Kommune, wo es einen geringen Gewerbesteuer-Hebesatz gibt, werden sich auch mehr Unternehmen ansiedeln, sodass dort mehr Arbeitsplätze entstehen.
Warum sonst sitzt SAP in Walldorf?  Warum sollten auch sonst Kommunen wie Monheim am Rhein (bei Düsseldorf) oder Eschborn (bei Frankfurt am Main) so einen geringen Gewerbesteuer-Hebesatz haben. Das ist alles Steuerpolitik und lockt Unternehmen in die Kommunen.
Lange Rede kurzer Sinn: Zu dieser Steuerart lässt sich sagen, dass jeder die Gewerbesteuer verstehen sollte, wenn Sie Ihre Steuerlast senken möchten.
Denn Achtung! Auch Sie kann die Gewerbesteuer treffen, wenn Sie z.B. unter bestimmten Voraussetzungen ein Haus veräußern oder Sie Ihre selbst hergestellten Vogelhäuser im Internet verkaufen.


Der Steuerrecht Mastkurs Teil 4 wird Ihnen die Gewerbsteuer aber gerne näherbringen. Der zweite Kurs Steuerrecht Masterkurs Teil 4 (2/2) wird sich mit Berechnungen und Beispiele beschäftigen.


In diesem Kurs lernen Sie aber zuerst einmal:
- Die Grundlagen und Merkmale der Gewerbesteuer kennenlernen
- Sie werden wissen, wann und wie eine Gewerbesteuerpflicht beginnt und wie diese sich gestaltet
- Sie werden unterschiedliche Rechtsformen im Zusammenhang mit der Gewerbesteuer kennenlernen wie bspw. GmbHs
- Die Abfärbetheorie wird für Sie kein Fremdwort mehr sein
- Ebenso die Steuerbefreiungen
- sowie auch die Gewinnermittlung und die Hinzurechnungen und Kürzungen der Gewerbesteuer
und noch vieles mehr...


Ich freue mich Sie gleich in meinem Kurs zu begrüßen.


Ihr
Nico Molitor


PS: Dieser Kurs beinhaltet keine individuelle Steuerberatung. Ein individuelle Steuerberatung kann nur ein Steuerberater mit einem abgeschlossen Examen durchführen. Hier lernen Sie nur, wie etwas funktioniert, sodass Sie eigene Schlüsse aus dem Kurs ziehen müssen. Steuerberatung ist eine individuelle Leistung, sodass nur ein Steuerberater Ihnen genau Auskunft in Ihren speziellen Fall geben kann.
Bitte prüfen Sie den Inhalt auf Aktualität und Richtigkeit. Ich übernehme keine Haftung für etwaige Fehler  die jeden mal passieren können. Dieser Kurs dient der Wissensübermittlung

courses.title: From Summonses to International Evidence Gathering Technique
courses.bio: How the IRS Gathers Evidence in the 21st Century
objectives: How do dual-purpose summonses differ from traditional summonses issued by the IRS, and what implications do these differences have for taxpayer privacy?
What challenges might the IRS face when utilizing grand jury subpoenas compared to administrative summonses, particularly in terms of compliance and enforcem
In what ways have international business practices influenced the evolution of the IRS's evidence-gathering techniques, particularly regarding tax fraud?
How does the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) alter the relationship between U.S. taxpayers and foreign financial institutions in terms of informat
What are the potential ethical dilemmas faced by foreign financial institutions when complying with U.S. tax laws, particularly in jurisdictions with strict
How effective are Mutual Legal Assistance Treaties (MLATs) in facilitating international cooperation for tax enforcement, and what limitations do they face?
In what scenarios might letters rogatory be preferred over other methods of international evidence gathering, and what are the potential drawbacks of this ap
How does the IRS balance the need for efficient evidence gathering with the rights of taxpayers during international investigations?
What role does judicial oversight play in the issuance of John Doe summonses, and how does this impact taxpayer rights and protections?
How can the IRS improve its strategies for combating international tax evasion while still respecting the privacy and legal rights of individuals?
What lessons can be learned from historical cases where IRS summonses were deemed unenforceable, and how might these lessons inform current practices?
How does the U.S. government's approach to international tax compliance compare with that of other countries, and what are the implications for global tax p
requirements: No formal tax experience is required.
courses.description:
This presentation will teach you how the government gathers information both domestically and internationally in the 21st century. There are tried and true methods that have been around since time and memorial as well as new techniques such as FATCA. We'll begin on the domestic side with IRS summonses, subpoenas, search warrants, and sting operations and then make our way to international evidence gathering. Specifically, we'll discuss mutual legal assistance treaties, tax treaties, information exchange agreements, FATCA, and letters rogatory.


The following questions will be addressed:


How do dual-purpose summonses differ from traditional summonses issued by the IRS, and what implications do these differences have for taxpayer privacy?
What challenges might the IRS face when utilizing grand jury subpoenas compared to administrative summonses, particularly in terms of compliance and enforcement?
In what ways have international business practices influenced the evolution of the IRS's evidence-gathering techniques, particularly regarding tax fraud?
How does the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) alter the relationship between U.S. taxpayers and foreign financial institutions in terms of information disclosure?
What are the potential ethical dilemmas faced by foreign financial institutions when complying with U.S. tax laws, particularly in jurisdictions with strict bank secrecy laws?
How effective are Mutual Legal Assistance Treaties (MLATs) in facilitating international cooperation for tax enforcement, and what limitations do they face?
In what scenarios might letters rogatory be preferred over other methods of international evidence gathering, and what are the potential drawbacks of this approach?
How does the IRS balance the need for efficient evidence gathering with the rights of taxpayers during international investigations?
What role does judicial oversight play in the issuance of John Doe summonses, and how does this impact taxpayer rights and protections?
How can the IRS improve its strategies for combating international tax evasion while still respecting the privacy and legal rights of individuals?
What lessons can be learned from historical cases where IRS summonses were deemed unenforceable, and how might these lessons inform current practices?
How does the U.S. government's approach to international tax compliance compare with that of other countries, and what are the implications for global tax policy?

O que é substituição tributária?
Substituição tributária (ST) é o regime no qual a responsabilidade pelo ICMS (imposto sobre circulação de mercadorias e serviços) é atribuída a um contribuinte diferente do que realizou a ação de venda. Como o próprio nome já diz, é uma forma de substituir o responsável pelo pagamento dos tributos.
De forma simplificada, poderíamos dizer que a substituição tributária é a cobrança do imposto de venda do produto no momento em que ele sai da indústria, ou seja, ao invés da cobrança ser feita quando ocorre a venda (fato gerador do imposto), ela é cobrada antecipadamente.


A grande maioria das industrias, fabricas e empresas importadoras recolhem o ICMS-ST nas suas operações, e hoje em dia, é muito dificil encontrar um profissional qualificado para tocar a área fiscal e ser responsavel pela Substituição tributaria.


Profissionais com experiência e conhecimento na Substituição tributária aumentam seu valor no mercado, pois geralmente quem possui este conhecimento são Analista Fiscal, Especialista Fiscal, ou Coordenador Fiscal.


Enfim, este é sem dúvidas o melhor curso sobre o assunto, pois trago pra vocês além da teoria, a prática de forma didática e eficaz.


Aprenda do básico ao avançado com este curso composto por 18 aulas inicialmente.

courses.title: Engineer’s Guide to Claiming SR&ED in Canada
courses.bio: A step-by-step guide for engineers and startups to prepare a CRA-compliant T661 claim—faster, smarter, and stress-free.
objectives: Understand SR&ED eligibility rules — Learn how to identify which R&D projects qualify under CRA’s definition of Scientific Research and Experimental Development
Write a CRA-compliant technical report — Follow the Line 242/244/246 structure to document technical uncertainty, work performed, and new knowledge gained.
Build an audit-proof documentation workflow — Learn how to organize time tracking, meeting notes, and technical logs to prepare for potential CRA reviews.
File your SR&ED claim 10× faster — Use templates and automation tools (like the GPT co-pilot) to complete your T661 report in under 1 hour.
requirements: No prior tax or legal knowledge needed. Ideal for technical founders, engineers, or product managers who worked on R&D but aren’t sure how to document it for SR&ED.
courses.description:
If you're an engineer or founder working in Canada, there's a good chance you're eligible for the SR&ED program—Canada's largest R&D tax incentive. But claiming it can feel overwhelming, time-consuming, or dependent on expensive consultants.
This course helps you take control of your SR&ED claim from start to finish.
Designed specifically for engineers, technical leads, and startup operators, you’ll learn exactly what the CRA is looking for—and how to write a strong, defensible claim even without a tax background.
What you'll learn:
What projects qualify under SR&ED
What time and costs are eligible to claim
How to track work, gather technical notes, and avoid audit red flags
How to write a strong Line 242 / 244 / 246 using CRA language
How to structure your documentation to save time and reduce risk
You’ll also receive access to guided writing aids and automated support tools designed to streamline the claim drafting process.
Whether you're preparing your first claim or improving a past one, this course will give you the clarity and confidence to file successfully—and get back to building.
By the end of this course, you’ll feel empowered to submit a technically sound, audit-ready SR&ED claim—on your own terms. Whether you're a startup founder, solo entrepreneur, or consultant, this course is designed to help you confidently navigate the SR&ED process on your own terms. No prior tax or legal experience is required to succeed.
target_audience: This course is for startup engineers, CTOs, and technical team leads in Canada who want to file their own SR&ED claims — faster, cheaper, and with full control — without hiring a tax consultant.

courses.description:
Olá, seja bem vindo ao curso online de Direito Tributário.
Eu sou Marteson Castelo Branco e você está aqui na Fábrica de Empreendedores. O conteúdo que abordarei aqui será com a mesma profundidade que aprendi no meu curso de pós-graduação, claro que com menos exemplos e mais resumido.
Nesse curso você aprenderá a parte teórica do Direito Tributário e alguns cálculos simples relacionados ao tributação. Serão apresentados os principais aspectos do direito tributário, mostrando seu conceito, os princípios, as limitações do poder de tributar do Estado. Serão abordados de maneira avançada os principais tributos do direito tributário brasileiro. Será falado sobre tipos de tributos e a diferença entre os mesmos. Os alunos aprenderão a identificar a legislação tributária na Constituição Federal, código tributário nacional e algumas leis específicas.
Para todos os interessados, em especial alunos de Administração, Direito, Processos gerenciais, Ciências econômicas, Finanças e afins.

courses.description:
Este curso é composto das seguinte aulas:
INTRODUÇÃO
QUEM ESTÁ OBRIGADO A DECLARAR O IR PESSOA FÍSICA EM 2021?
QUEM ESTÁ OBRIGADO A DECLARAR MILHAS AÉREAS?
6 MOTIVOS PARA VOCÊ DECLARAR SUAS MILHAS AÉREAS
ENTENDENDO O GCAP


COMO DECLARAR AS MILHAS AÉREAS - ESTUDO DE CASOS
DECLARANDO MILHAS AÉREAS ADQUIRIDAS NA COMPRA DE PASSAGENS AÉREAS
DECLARANDO AQUISIÇÃO DE MILHAS AÉREAS
DECLARANDO MILHAS ADQUIRIDAS NA COMPRA DE PASSAGENS
DECLARANDO MILHAS ADQUIRIDAS NA COMPRA COM CARTÃO DE CRÉDITO
DECLARANDO MILHAS ADQUIRIDAS USANDO PROGRAMA DE PONTOS
DECLARANDO MILHAS ADQUIRIDAS NOS PROGRAMAS DE CIAS AÉREAS
DECLARANDO MILHAS ADQUIRIDAS TRANSFERINDO PONTOS
DECLARANDO MILHAS ADQUIRIDAS TRANSFERINDO PRODUTOS
DECLARANDO MILHAS ADQUIRIDAS COMPRANDO PRODUTOS
DECLARANDO MILHAS ADQUIRIDAS PAGANDO BOLETOS


COMO DECLARAR A VENDA DE MILHAS AÉREAS COM GANHO DE CAPITAL, COM PREJUÍZO, NA HERANÇA


O QUE PODE ACONTECER SE NÃO DECLARAR AS MILHAS AÉREAS?
________________________________________________________________________________
Como saber se você precisa declarar suas milhas no Imposto de Renda?
Embora o mercado de milhas ainda não tenha uma regulamentação própria, ele gera lucro para quem atua nele. Por esse motivo, essas pessoas devem declarar tais operações no Imposto de Renda. Contudo, nem todo mundo será obrigado a informar esses ganhos ao Leão. Assim, o primeiro passo para descobrir se você deve ou não fazer a declaração é entender as regras do jogo.
A declaração de Imposto de Renda é feita todos os anos entre os meses de março e abril. Contudo, ela se refere aos ganhos e gastos que você teve no ano anterior. Além disso, existem três critérios gerais para definir se é necessário ou não preencher esses documentos.
Documentos específicos do Imposto de Renda com milhas
Além das regras gerais para declaração do Imposto de Renda, temos as normas específicas para quem realizou transações com milhas e precisa informar os ganhos e gastos ao Leão. Confira a seguir quais são.
VEJA QUAIS SÃO OS DOCUMENTOS QUE VOCÊ PRECISA PREENCHER NO SEU IMPOSTO DE RENDA
GCAP
O Programa de Ganhos de Capital é uma declaração complementar ao Imposto de Renda da pessoa física. Ele é preenchido mensalmente sempre que o seu ganho foi superior a um valor pré-estabelecido. Assim, se durante um mês a sua venda de milhas alcançou um valor superior a R$ 35.000,00, você deve preencher esse documento e pagar o imposto devido.
Dessa forma, se em um ano você foi obrigado a preencher o GCAP terá que fazer a declaração de Imposto de Renda no ano seguinte. Para ficar mais claro, imagine que em 2020 você teve que fazer esse documento no mês de abril. Foi a única vez, mas por esse motivo, você já deverá fazer a declaração completa.
DIRPF
O segundo documento que devemos preencher é a Declaração de Imposto de Renda da Pessoa Física. Essa é a declaração de ajuste de imposto que é feita todos os anos nos meses de março e abril. Nela, você deve informar todos os seus ganhos e gastos do ano anterior. Ou seja, salário, bens, operações na bolsa, transações com milhas, etc.
Resumindo, nessa declaração você informa tudo. Tanto o que está nas regras gerais do Imposto de Renda, quanto aquilo que não é obrigatório. Como falamos anteriormente, se por algum motivo você precisar preencher esse documento, certifique-se de incluir todas as informações possíveis.
O QUE VOCÊ PRECISA INFORMAR NO IMPOSTO DE RENDA DE PESSOA FÍSICA
Dito isso, vamos focar nas informações que são importantes para quem precisa preencher o Imposto de Renda por conta das operações com milhas. A primeira área a ser informada é “Saldos de bens e direitos”. Nessa seção você deve dizer quantas milhas possui e o valor correspondente em reais. Ou seja, mesmo que não tenha feito nenhuma operação com os pontos, é importante que eles constem como bens na sua declaração.
Da mesma forma, no quadro “Ganho de capital” você precisa informar TODAS, isso mesmo, todas as suas operações de compra e venda de milhas. Se você preencheu o GCAP pode aproveitar e importar todas essas informações para facilitar o seu trabalho.
Como funciona a taxação do Imposto de Renda nas operações com milhas no Brasil?
Bom, depois de saber se é obrigado ou não a pagar o Imposto de Renda, você deve estar se perguntando quanto vai pagar, afinal. No Imposto de Renda geral (DIRPF) provavelmente vão ser incluídos outros gastos e ganhos que você teve ao longo do ano. Assim, não podemos dizer qual será o valor exato.
SAIBA QUAL É A ALÍQUOTA DAS SUAS OPERAÇÕES COM MILHAS
Mas, vamos ensinar como é feita a taxação da declaração mensal. Ou seja, o GCAP. No Brasil, o Imposto de Renda é um tributo progressivo. Isto é, a taxa cobrada varia de acordo com o que é informado por cada pessoa. O mesmo acontece quando você precisa preencher esse documento por causa das operações com milhas.
Funciona assim:
Para venda mensal de milhas de até R$ 35 mil você está isento de IR;
Entretanto, nas operações com vendas entre R$ 35 mil e R$ 5 milhões você deverá pagar 15% de Imposto de Renda sobre o lucro;
Por fim, as operações com valores acima de R$ 5 milhões podem ser tributadas em até 30% sobre o lucro.
target_audience: Todos aqueles que querem aprender como declarar suas milhas aéreas, e aqueles que de modo avançado querem comprar e vender milhas aéreas.
